intro: Sphaeralcea coquimbana, commonly known as the Coquimbo globemallow, is a perennial plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sphaeralcea coquimbana is often found in coastal scrub and rocky habitats along the Pacific coast.
